CreateProductSecret.document: This API is used to create a Tencent Cloud service credential.
CreateProductSecret.name: Creates Tencent Cloud service credential

CreateSSHKeyPairSecret.document: This API is used to create a secret that hosts SSH keys.
CreateSSHKeyPairSecret.name: Creates an SSH key secret

CreateSecret.document: This API is used to create a KMS-encrypted Secret. You can create and store up to 1,000 Secrets in each region.
CreateSecret.name: Creates a Secret

DeleteSecret.document: This API is used to delete a Secret. You can set whether to delete the Secret immediately or on schedule using the `RecoveryWindowInDays` parameter. For a Secret to be deleted on schedule, its status will be `PendingDelete` before the scheduled deletion time. You can use `RestoreSecret` to restore a deleted Secret during this time. A deleted Secret will not be restorable after the scheduled deletion time. A Secret can only be deleted after being disabled using `DisableSecret`.
DeleteSecret.name: Deletes a Secret

DeleteSecretVersion.document:
This API is used to directly delete a single credential version under the specified credential. The deletion takes effect immediately, and the credential version in all status can be deleted.
This API is only applicable to user-defined credentials but not Tencent Cloud service credentials.
DeleteSecretVersion.name: Deletes a Secret version

DescribeAsyncRequestInfo.document: This API is used to query the execution result of an async task.
DescribeAsyncRequestInfo.name: Queries the execution result of async task

DescribeRotationDetail.document:
This API is used to query the details of a credential rotation policy.
This API is only applicable to Tencent Cloud service credentials.
DescribeRotationDetail.name: Queries credential rotation details

DescribeRotationHistory.document:
This API is used to query the historical versions of a rotated credential.
This API is only applicable to Tencent Cloud service credentials.
DescribeRotationHistory.name: Queries the historical versions of rotated credential

DescribeSecret.document: This API is used to obtain the detailed attribute information of a Secret.
DescribeSecret.name: Obtains the detailed information of a Secret

DescribeSupportedProducts.document: This API is used to query the list of supported Tencent Cloud services.
DescribeSupportedProducts.name: Queries the list of supported Tencent Cloud services

DisableSecret.document: This API is used to disable a Secret and will change its status to `Disabled`. The plaintext of a disabled Secret cannot be obtained through APIs.
DisableSecret.name: Disables a Secret

EnableSecret.document: This API is used to enable a Secret and will change its status to `Enabled`. You can call the `GetSecretValue` API to obtain the plaintext of this Secret. Secrets in `PendingDelete` status can only be enabled after being restored by using `RestoreSecret`.
EnableSecret.name: Enables a Secret

GetRegions.document: This API is used to obtain the list of regions displayed on Console.
GetRegions.name: Obtains the list of regions displayed on Console

GetSSHKeyPairValue.document: This API is used to obtain the plaintext value of the SSH key secret.
GetSSHKeyPairValue.name: Obtains the plaintext value of the SSH key secret

GetSecretValue.document:
For user-defined credentials, this API is used to get the plaintext information of a credential by specifying the credential name and version.
For Tencent Cloud service credentials such as MySQL credentials, this API is used to get the plaintext information of a previously rotated credential by specifying the credential name and historical version number. If you want to get the plaintext of the credential version currently in use, you need to specify the version number as `SSM_Current`.
GetSecretValue.name: Obtains the plaintext of a Secret

GetServiceStatus.document: This API is used to obtain the SecretsManager service status of a user.
GetServiceStatus.name: Obtains the service status of a user

ListSecretVersionIds.document: This API is used to obtain list of versions of a Secret.
ListSecretVersionIds.name: Obtains the list of versions of a Secret

ListSecrets.document: This API is used to obtain the detailed information list of all Secrets. You can specify the filter fields and sorting order as needed.
ListSecrets.name: Obtains the list of Secret information

PutSecretValue.document:
This API adds the new version of the credential content under the specified credential. One credential can have up to 10 versions. New versions can be added to credentials only in `Enabled` or `Disabled` status.
This API is only applicable to user-defined credentials but not Tencent Cloud service credentials.
PutSecretValue.name: Adds a new Secret version

RestoreSecret.document: This API is used to restore a `PendingDelete` Secret, canceling its scheduled deletion. The restored Secret will be in `Disabled` status. You can call the `EnableSecret` API to enable this Secret again.
RestoreSecret.name: Restores a `PendingDelete` Secret

RotateProductSecret.document:
This API is used to rotate secrets for Tencent Cloud services or Tencent Cloud API key pairs.
Note that only the secrets with the "Enabled" status can be rotated.
RotateProductSecret.name: Rotates Tencent Cloud service credential

UpdateDescription.document: This API is used to update the description of a Secret. This API can only update Secrets in `Enabled` or `Disabled` status.
UpdateDescription.name: Updates the description of a Secret

UpdateRotationStatus.document:
This API is used to set a Tencent Cloud service credential rotation policy, including the following parameters:
Specifies whether to enable rotation
Rotation frequency
Rotation start time
UpdateRotationStatus.name: Sets Tencent Cloud service credential rotation policy

UpdateSecret.document:
This API is used to update the credential content of the specified credential name and version number. Calling this API will encrypt the content of the new credential and overwrite the old content. Only credentials in `Enabled` or `Disabled` status can be updated.
This API is only applicable to user-defined credentials but not Tencent Cloud service credentials.
UpdateSecret.name: Updates the content of a Secret

members.document: Credential name, which must be unique in the same region. It can contain 128 bytes of letters, digits, hyphens, and underscores and must begin with a letter or digit.
members.name: SecretName

members.document:
Prefix of the user account name, which is specified by you and can contain up to 8 characters.
Supported character sets include:
Digits: [0, 9].
Lowercase letters: [a, z].
Uppercase letters: [A, Z].
Special symbols: underscore.
The prefix must begin with a letter.
members.name: UserNamePrefix

members.document: Name of the Tencent Cloud service bound to the credential, such as `Mysql`. The `DescribeSupportedProducts` API can be used to get the names of the supported Tencent Cloud services.
members.name: ProductName

members.document: Tencent Cloud service instance ID.
members.name: InstanceID

members.document: Domain name of the account in the form of IP. You can enter `%`.
members.name: Domains

members.document: List of permissions that need to be granted when the credential is bound to a Tencent Cloud service.
members.name: PrivilegesList

members.document: Description, which is used to describe the purpose in detail and can contain up to 2,048 bytes.
members.name: Description

members.document:
Specifies the KMS CMK that encrypts the credential.
If this parameter is left empty, the CMK created by Secrets Manager by default will be used for encryption.
You can also specify a custom KMS CMK created in the same region for encryption.
members.name: KmsKeyId

members.document: List of tags.
members.name: Tags

members.document:
User-Defined rotation start time in the format of 2006-01-02 15:04:05.
When `EnableRotation` is `True`, this parameter is required.
members.name: RotationBeginTime

members.document:
Specifies whether to enable rotation
True - enable
False - do not enable
If this parameter is not specified, `False` will be used by default.
members.name: EnableRotation

members.document: Rotation frequency in days. Default value: 1 day.
members.name: RotationFrequency

members.document: Name of the created credential.
members.name: SecretName

members.document:
Tag operation return code. 0: success; 1: internal error; 2: business processing error.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TagCode

members.document:
Tag operation return message.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TagMsg

members.name: FlowID

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Secret name, which must be unique in the same region. It can contain 128 bytes of letters, digits, hyphens and underscores and must begin with a letter or digit.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: ID of the project to which the created SSH key belongs.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: Description, such as what it is used for. It contains up to 2,048 bytes.

members.document:
Specifies a KMS CMK to encrypt the secret.
If this parameter is left empty, the CMK created by Secrets Manager by default will be used for encryption.
You can also specify a custom KMS CMK created in the same region for encryption.
members.name: KmsKeyId

members.document: List of tags.
members.name: Tags

members.document: Name of the SSH key pair, which only contains digits, letters and underscores and must start with a digit or letter. The maximum length is 25 characters.
members.name: SSHKeyName

members.document: Name of the created secret.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: ID of the created SSH key.
members.name: SSHKeyID

members.document: Name of the created SSH key.
members.name: SSHKeyName

members.document:
Tag return code. `0`: success; `1`: internal error; `2`: business processing error.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TagCode

members.document:
Tag return message.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TagMsg

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Secret name, which must be unique in the same region. It can contain 128 bytes ([a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], [-_]). It must begin with a letter or digit. Note that it cannot be modified once created.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: Secret version. It can contain up to 64 bytes ([a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], [-_.]). It must begin with a letter or digit. `SecretName` and `VersionId` are used to query the Secret information. If it is left empty, the initial Secret version number is used by default.
members.name: VersionId

members.document: Description information, such as the detailed use cases. It can be up to 2048 bytes.
members.name: Description

members.document: KMS CMK used for Secret encryption. If this parameter is left empty, SecretsManager will create a CMK by default. You can also specify a KMS CMK that is created in the same region.
members.name: KmsKeyId

members.document: Secret type. It defaults to `custom`.
members.name: SecretType

members.document: Base64-encoded plaintext of a binary Secret. Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` must be set. A maximum of 4096 bytes is supported.
members.name: SecretBinary

members.document: Plaintext of a Secret, in text format. Base64 encoding is not required. Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` must be set. A maximum of 4096 bytes is supported.
members.name: SecretString

members.document: Additional configuration of the Secret in JSON format
members.name: AdditionalConfig

members.document: List of tags.
members.name: Tags

Return code of tag operation. `0`: success; `1`: internal error; `2`: business processing error
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.

Return message of tag operation.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.

members.document:
Scheduled deletion time (in days), indicating the number of retention days for the secret. Value range: 0-30. If it is `0`, the secret is deleted immediately.
For an SSH key secret, this field can only be `0`.
members.name: RecoveryWindowInDays

members.document:
Specifies whether to delete the SSH key from both the secret and the SSH key list in the CVM console. This field is only valid for SSH key secrets. Valid values:
`True`: deletes SSH key from both the secret and SSH key list in the CVM console. Note that the deletion will fail if the SSH key is already bound to a CVM instance.
`False`: only deletes the SSH key information in the secret.
members.name: CleanSSHKey

members.document:
Specifies the version number of the corresponding credential.
For Tencent Cloud service credentials such as MySQL credentials, this API is used to get the plaintext information of a previously rotated credential by specifying the credential name and historical version number. If you want to get the plaintext of the credential version currently in use, you need to specify the version number as `SSM_Current`.
members.name: VersionId

members.document: Name of the Secret.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: ID of the Secret version.
members.name: VersionId

members.document:
When creating a credential (CreateSecret), if you specify binary data, this field will be the Base64-encoded returned result. The application needs to Base64-decode the result to get the original data.
Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` cannot be empty.
members.name: SecretBinary

members.document:
When creating a credential (CreateSecret), if you specify general text data, this field will be the returned result.
Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` cannot be empty.
members.name: SecretString

members.name: RequestId

members.document: `true`: The service is activated; `false`: The service is not activated.
members.name: ServiceEnabled

members.document: Invalid service type. `0`: not purchased; `1`: normal; `2`: suspended due to arrears; `3`: resource released
members.name: InvalidType

members.document:
`true`: Allow SSM to manage Tencent Cloud API key secrets.
`false`: Forbid SSM to manage Tencent Cloud API key secrets.
members.name: AccessKeyEscrowEnabled

Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.

members.name: RequestId

members.document: Starting position of the list, starting at 0. If not specified, 0 is used by default.
members.name: Offset

members.document: Maximum number of returned Secrets in a query. If not set or set to 0, 20 is used by default.
members.name: Limit

members.document: Sorting order according to the creation time. If not set or set to 0, descending order is used; if set to 1, ascending order is used.
members.name: OrderType

members.document:
Filter based on credential status.
The default value is 0, indicating to query all.
1: query the list of credentials in `Enabled` status.
2: query the list of credentials in `Disabled` status.
3: query the list of credentials in `PendingDelete` status.
4: query the list of credentials in `PendingCreate` status.
5: query the list of credentials in `CreateFailed` status.
The `PendingCreate` and `CreateFailed` status only take effect when `SecretType` is Tencent Cloud service credential
members.name: State

members.document: Filter according to Secret names. If left empty, this filter is not applied.
members.name: SearchSecretName

members.document: Tag filter.
members.name: TagFilters

members.document:
`0` (default): user-defined secret.
`1`: Tencent Cloud services secret.
`2`: SSH key secret.
`3`: Tencent Cloud API key secret.
members.name: SecretType

members.document:
This parameter is valid only when SecretType is `1`.
 
An empty value indicates querying all types of Tencent Cloud service secrets.
`Mysql`: queries MySQL database credentials.
`Tdsql-mysql`: queries TDSQL MySQL database credentials.
members.name: ProductName

members.document: Number of filtered Secrets according to `State` and `SearchSecretName`.
members.name: TotalCount

members.document: List of Secret information.
members.name: SecretMetadatas

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

ProductPrivilegeUnit.document: Permission granted when the credential is associated with the service

members.document:
Permission name. Valid values:
GlobalPrivileges
DatabasePrivileges
TablePrivileges
ColumnPrivileges

When the permission is `DatabasePrivileges`, the database name must be specified by the `Database` parameter;

When the permission is `TablePrivileges`, the database name and the table name in the database must be specified by the `Database` and `TableName` parameters;

When the permission is `ColumnPrivileges`, the database name, table name in the database, and column name in the table must be specified by the `Database`, `TableName`, and `ColumnName` parameters.
members.name: PrivilegeName

members.document:
Permission list.
For the `Mysql` service, optional permission values are:

1. Valid values of `GlobalPrivileges`: "SELECT","INSERT","UPDATE","DELETE","CREATE", "PROCESS", "DROP","REFERENCES","INDEX","ALTER","SHOW DATABASES","CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES","LOCK TABLES","EXECUTE","CREATE VIEW","SHOW VIEW","CREATE ROUTINE","ALTER ROUTINE","EVENT","TRIGGER".
Note: if this parameter is not passed in, it means to clear the permission.

2. Valid values of `DatabasePrivileges`: "SELECT","INSERT","UPDATE","DELETE","CREATE", "DROP","REFERENCES","INDEX","ALTER","CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES","LOCK TABLES","EXECUTE","CREATE VIEW","SHOW VIEW","CREATE ROUTINE","ALTER ROUTINE","EVENT","TRIGGER".
Note: if this parameter is not passed in, it means to clear the permission.

3. Valid values of `TablePrivileges`: "SELECT","INSERT","UPDATE","DELETE","CREATE", "DROP","REFERENCES","INDEX","ALTER","CREATE VIEW","SHOW VIEW", "TRIGGER".
Note: if this parameter is not passed in, it means to clear the permission.

4. Valid values of `ColumnPrivileges`: "SELECT","INSERT","UPDATE","REFERENCES".
Note: if this parameter is not passed in, it means to clear the permission.
members.name: Privileges

members.document: This value takes effect only when `PrivilegeName` is `DatabasePrivileges`.
members.name: Database

members.document: This value takes effect only when `PrivilegeName` is `TablePrivileges`, and the `Database` parameter is required in this case to explicitly indicate the database instance.
members.name: TableName

members.document:
This value takes effect only when `PrivilegeName` is `ColumnPrivileges`, and the following parameters are required in this case:
Database: explicitly indicate the database instance.
TableName: explicitly indicate the table
members.name: ColumnName

Base64-encoded binary credential information.
Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` must be set.

members.document:
Secret name. This field is only valid when the `SecretType` is set to `2` (SSH key secret).
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ResourceName

members.document:
Project ID. This field is only valid when the `SecretType` is set to `2` (SSH key secret).
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ProjectID

members.document:
ID of the CVM instance associated with the SSH key. ID. This field is only valid when the `SecretType` is set to `2` (SSH key secret).
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AssociatedInstanceIDs

members.document:
UIN of the Tencent Cloud API key. This field is valid when the secret type is Tencent Cloud API key secret.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TargetUin

members.document:
Rotation frequency in days. It takes effect when the rotation feature is enabled. 
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RotationFrequency

members.document:
ID of Tencent Cloud resource corresponding with the Secret. 
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ResourceID

members.document:
The rotation start time.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RotationBeginTime

members.document: Tag key
members.name: TagKey

members.document: Tag value
members.name: TagValue

members.document: Tag key
members.name: TagKey

members.document: Tag value
members.name: TagValue

members.document: Name of a Secret whose description is to be updated.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: New description information, which can be up to 2048 bytes.
members.name: Description

members.document: Name of the Secret.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Tencent Cloud service credential name.
members.name: SecretName

members.document:
Specifies whether to enable rotation.
`true`: enables rotation.
`false`: disables rotation.
members.name: EnableRotation

members.document: Rotation frequency in days. Value range: 30–365.
members.name: Frequency

members.document:
User-defined rotation start time in the format of 2006-01-02 15:04:05.
When `EnableRotation` is `true` and `RotationBeginTime` is left empty, the current time will be entered by default.
members.name: RotationBeginTime

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Name of a Secret whose content is to be updated.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: ID of the Secret version whose content is to be updated.
members.name: VersionId

members.document:
This field should be used and Base64-encoded if the content of the new credential is binary.
Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` cannot be empty.
members.name: SecretBinary

members.document: This field should be used without being Base64-encoded if the content of the new credential is text. Either `SecretBinary` or `SecretString` cannot be empty.
members.name: SecretString

members.document: Name of the Secret.
members.name: SecretName

members.document: Version ID of the Secret.
members.name: VersionId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Version ID.
members.name: VersionId

members.document: Creation time, formatted as a Unix timestamp.
members.name: CreateTime
